thread.title: Zlatan Ibrahimovic elbow on Tyrone Mings used as evidence in Dutch disciplinary case involving Paul Pogba's brother
thread.title_full: Zlatan Ibrahimovic elbow on Tyrone Mings used as evidence in Dutch disciplinary case involving Paul Pogba's brother

author: David McDonnell
title: Zlatan Ibrahimovic elbow on Tyrone Mings used as evidence in Dutch disciplinary case involving Paul Pogba's brother
text:
Zlatan Ibrahimovic elbow on Tyrone Mings used as evidence in Dutch disciplinary case involving Paul Pogba's brother The Feyenoord midfielder has appealed against a four-match ban for an elbow he claims was accidental Share Vilhena was hit with a four-game ban - but argued it was unintentional Share Get Manchester United FC   Thank you for subscribing! Could   
Zlatan Ibrahimovic's elbow on Tyrone Mings has been used as evidence in a Dutch disciplinary case. 
Feyenoord lawyer Joris van Benthem stunned a football tribunal by mentioning the Swede while defending Tonny Vilhena. 
The Holland midfielder was appealing against a four-match ban for elbowing Paul Pogba’s brother Mathias, who plays for Sparta Rotterdam. 
Vilhena claimed the clash was accidental. 
Then his lawyer showed footage of Ibra catching Mings’ face last week and told the hearing: “THAT is an elbow. Ibrahimovic elbows Mings - he's been handed a three-game ban (Photo: AFP/Getty) Read More Bournemouth furious after FA slap defender Tyrone Mings with five-match ban 
"Vilhena is not a Zlatan. Certain players, like in this case Zlatan against the Bournemouth defender, first make a fist with their hand. He brings the fist to his chest, so he can dish out with full power. 
“It is completely different from what our players do here. They jump in the air and don’t even look around them.” 
But the tribunal upheld the ban. poll loading Did Zlatan lose his head? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
